alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Coastal Bay; Coastal Gulf; Inland Bay; Inland Gulf; Liberty (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 12 at 4:26AM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT GULF...SOUTHEASTERN BAY... SOUTHWESTERN CALHOUN COUNTIES IN THE PANHANDLE OF FLORIDA AND WEST CENTRAL LIBERTY COUNTIES IN BIG BEND FLORIDA THROUGH 515 AM EDT/415 AM CDT/... At 426 AM EDT/326 AM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Callaway to 19 miles southwest of Tyndall Air Force Base. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Panama City, Callaway, Springfield, Mexico Beach, Stonemill Creek, Tyndall Air Force Base, Parker, Wewahitchka, Honeyville, Allanton, Cedar Grove, Chipola Cutoff, Beacon Beach, Overstreet, Scotts Ferry, Davis Beach, Kinard, Chipola Park, Millville, and Wetappo. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 AM EDT/800 AM CDT/ for the Panhandle of Florida.
